attributes.action: exercise greater control on the profligate spending by  the National Audit Office in general and the Auditor General ,Sir John Bourn, in particular
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: The National Audit Office has responsibility to monitor government expenditure yet it fails to exercise such monitoring and control of its own expenditure. Since 2004, its Auditor General, Sir John Bourn has spent £27000 of public money on meals at restaurants such as the Ritz and Savoy. The travel bill has exceeded £365000 for him and his wife over the last three years, including first class air travel. This is an appalling and profligate waste of taxpayers money by the body charged with the responsibility to ensure our money is wisely spent

reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
